learning_objective: Create interactive data visualizations using software tools to help others better understand real-world phenomena.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex has begun an internship at a company studying market trends. They notice that over the past four years, sales of a certain product increased during times when local unemployment rates decreased. Alex decides to create an interactive line graph to demonstrate this correlation. What two variables should be plotted on the x and y-axes?",
    "Answer1": "Product sales on the x-axis, unemployment rates on the y-axis",
    "Answer2": "Product sales and unemployment rates on the x-axis, time on the y-axis",
    "Answer3": "Time on the x-axis, product sales and unemployment rates on the y-axis",
    "Answer4": "Unemployment rates on the x-axis, time on the y-axis",
    "CorrectAnswer": "3",
    "Explanation": "When illustrating time-series data, it is conventional to place the independent variable 'time' on the x-axis and the dependent variable(s) - in this case, product sales and unemployment rates - on the y-axis in order to visually demonstrate how these vary over time."
}
